text: Caterpillar Hoplodrina respersa, the sprinkled rustic, is a moth of the family Noctuidae. It is known from southern and central Europe, the southern part of European Russia, Asia Minor, Turkey and Transcaucasus. Adults are on wing from May to August. The larvae feed on various herbaceous plants. ==References== ==External links== *Lepiforum.de *Vlindernet.nl Category:Caradrinini Category:Moths of Europe Category:Moths of Turkey Category:Moths described in 1775 Category:Taxa named by Michael Denis Category:Taxa named by Ignaz Schiffermüller
title: Hoplodrina respersa
